content.text:
# Draft:Jacob Ward

Jacob Ward is an American actor. He is best known for his role in Somewhere in Queens as Matthew
"Sticks" Russo (2023).
Career
Ward made his feature film debut in 2023, playing the lead role of Matthew "Sticks" Russo in Ray
Romano's directorial debut Somewhere in Queens. The film premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival on
June 10, 2022, and released in theaters on April 21, 2023. Ward starred alongside Romano, Laurie
Metcalf, Sebastian Maniscalco, Tony Lo Bianco, and Sadie Stanley, playing Romano and Metcalf's son.
The film garnered favorable reviews, as did Ward's performance. Deadline critic Pete Hammond found
Ward's work "understated and terrific." Patrick Gibbs of SLUG Magazine stated that, "he should be a
dark horse Oscar contender for this breakthrough performance."
In 2024, he was cast as the lead in the Vietnam draft drama Summerhouse alongside Malcolm McDowell and Abigail Cowen.
In 2025, he played a supporting role as Nathaniel Ballard in the independent Western film This Bloody Country.
